{"step_by_step_thinking": "Amphotericin B is a medication commonly used to treat fungal infections. It works by binding to the fungal cell membrane, causing leakage of intracellular contents and ultimately leading to cell death. One of the side effects of Amphotericin B is renal toxicity, which can result in electrolyte imbalances. Hypokalemia is a known side effect of Amphotericin B. Therefore, the correct answer is A.
